Subject: Re: [junit] Re: writing a test case for a function which returns void
From: Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...>

> Does it make sense to write a test case for a function which returns
> void.

If you think that a method is worth testing, go for it!  A method which returns void certainly does something to your object (otherwise what is the method for...).  So instead of "asserting" the returned value, assert an object's variable or state (or whatever).

public void testFunc () {
   myObject.Func(2, 3);
   assertTrue(myObject.getValue() == 5);
}

Happy testing!

-Vladimir
subject: Re: [junit] Re: writing a test case for a function which returns void
